attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget by 50% and use this money to save the NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis and needs urgent investment. This money would allow for more facilities to be built, more training and recruitment of doctors and nurses, more research and extra mental health provisions. Also, as people are living longer the NHS needs more facilities to help the elderly.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple reports from healthcare experts, RCN, news reports etc all point to our NHS being at breaking point.

attributes.action: Get compensation from the Government for the Immigration (Windrush) Victims
attributes.background: The people who have been threatened with deportation, who have lost wages and jobs and the stress of having to apply for citizenship in a country (GB) where they understood they had a right to stay. The Government has not kept the records pre-1973. That is a failure on the Government's part .
attributes.additional_details: I have lived here for 61 years, worked, paid tax, married, passed my driving test etc.  I was never questioned re my Canadian birth cert, I arrived here on my mother's Passport as she returned to England after my Fathers death in Canada 1956. My father fought in the last world war as a volunteer. I have always known I had an independent right to stay. I have now had to apply for citizenship, been stopped from working for 15 months. Loss of earnings is debilitating. I am stressed out and angry.

attributes.action: Mandate display of plastic:food volume ratio on all packaged foods items.
attributes.background:
More than 8 million tonnes of plastic reaches our oceans each year. 
By providing consumers with a plastic:food ratio on all packaging (with an associated red, amber or green rating) we will give them the facts to enable them to accept or reject products based on their impact on our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Department of Health's colour coded front-of-pack scheme was introduced in 2009 and gives consumers the nutritional info they need to make the best choices for their health. Research into similar schemes has shown that sales of green items increased by 5% and sales of red items decreased by 9%.

Showing the ratio of plastic packaging:food volume empowers consumers to make the best choice for the health of our oceans. Let consumer power change the way global food corporations package.

attributes.action: Lower the driving age to 15
attributes.background: Many students have to walk to school due to their families working or broken families. Result? many students get involved in alleyway gangs some can then skip school. If these students were allowed to drive they wouldn't get involved in drugs, but instead they wud be able to get to school and learn.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all non-recyclable plastics in the UK by 2025
attributes.background:
Plastic is a direct threat to the long term survival of all species, with the amount of plastic pollution in the oceans and land expanding at a catastrophic rate.
HM Government's strategy on plastic waste is inadequate in its current form and must be reviewed to ban all harmful plastics by 2025.

attributes.action: Stop firms from increasing subscription prices during a contract.
attributes.background: When customers sign up to mobile, broadband, landline or a TV contract there is always a clause that the company can increase their prices in line with inflation.  A contract price should remain the same throughout its duration. This unfair practice needs to stop.

attributes.action: Increased sentences for assaulting a police officer.
attributes.background: The police do a difficult and quite often thankless job in order to keep our communities safe, all too often this can be a very dangerous job.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for assaulting a police officer ranges from a from a fine to a maximum of 6 months in prison. 

Recently a police officer in the West Midlands police was assaulted and had a large chunk of hair ripped from her head whilst attending a domestic incident, her attacker received a paltry 12 weeks suspended sentence. 
https://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-01-12/police-woman-has-hair-ripped-out-after-being-assaulted-on-shift/ 

This kind of lenient sentencing will only serve to demoralise the police when they should be given full support from the courts. I therefore propose that a minimum custodial sentence of 18 months be introduced for any assault on a police officer.

attributes.action: Increase the lowest maintenance loans from student finance.
attributes.background: This petition sets out to up the lowest maintenance loan but keep the highest loan where it is. Many students struggle with what they receive.
attributes.additional_details: The lowest loan you can get whilst living on your own is around £4000 a year, for me, this was not even enough to cover just my rent let alone food. Many people find themselves in the same situation where they struggle to get by and are forced to basically live on the breadline by the government. The minimum loan should be upped to £5500 to avoid students getting into their overdraft and debt before even leaving university to enter the working world.

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Abolish the "Dangerous dogs act 1991" and replace it with a licence to keep dogs
attributes.background:
The so called dangerous dogs act was created in haste and without much research on the dogs themselves.

I feel any respectful owner would happily pay a 1 off fee to keep a family dog(s) and hopefully keep them from falling into the wrong hands, please sign this petition to legalise these breeds
attributes.additional_details:
Small dogs are generally more agressive than any large breed, Chihuahuas are recorded with most bites but they dont do as much damage as a large breed and this is deemed to be acceptable which it is not.

Pitbulls are caring, loving, faithful family dogs where in America they are effectionally known as the "nanny dog"

Pitbulls in the uk are a very misunderstood breed and have been stigmatized because of small minded individuals that used these dogs in the wrong setting i.e fighting

attributes.action: Allow motorbikes to use all bus lanes
attributes.background:
There are huge amounts of accidents where bikers are filtering and are knocked off due to other traffic. Whilst this is legal according to the highway code, the results usually end up 50/50 to both parties.

Allowing motorbikes to use bus lanes will reduce congestion and risk to everyone.

attributes.action: Students doing history GCSE's should learn 5 units for History instead of 4.
attributes.background: I personally am a strong believer that GCSE's currently are just a test of memory, and the hardest working students should be segregated from those who's efforts are inadequate.
attributes.additional_details: From the information I have acquired from students doing the 2018 GCSE History examinations, doing 4 units of history was not challenging for them and the task was too easily completed. They knew that they were not being tested to their full potential of memorisation and would be interested in doing an extra unit. Additionally, a fifth unit would not only further test the exam skills of each candidate, but would also help in ensuring those who succeed are the very best and most hardworking.

attributes.action: To raise the issue of forced marriages with the governments of other countries.
attributes.background: me and some other students are doing a citizenship campaign and one of the things we need to is take action. the rates of forced marriage in other countries are very high and we would like to make a change.

attributes.action: If a person uses a vehicle as a weapon they should receive a lifetime ban
attributes.background: If a person gets into a vehicle and ultimately uses that vehicle as a weapon then they should get an automatic lifetime ban from driving on top of any convictions that the courts see fit to administer.
attributes.additional_details:
It is quickly becoming a new trend for people to jump into a vehicle and drive it into a crowd, this is a problem on several fronts including terrorism. 

The courts deal with the criminal aspect by handing out custodial sentences, however when the convicted party leaves prison they are allowed to reapply for a licence or continue driving as the bans handed out are normally spent whilst in prison.

If these offenders were convicted of Animal Cruelty they would receive a lifetime ban.

attributes.action: Don't Abolish the House of Lords!
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a great parliamentary asset. Having a body that checks the Commons while being outside of the electoral process prevents rivalry and keeps the system balanced!
attributes.additional_details: If we had an elected Senate in place of the Lords, it would simply rival the Commons. Fundamentally, in elected office, politicians must make promises that pander to voters to keep them elected. The House of Lords doesn't have to fear electoral defeat because they have lifelong tenure and can focus on getting the job done of checking policy! They don't need to be accountable; that's what we have the Commons for whose power is the greatest of the two houses!

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: Give students in unaffordable cities larger student loans for unaffordable rent.
attributes.background: Winchester, outside of London is the second most expensive place to live in the UK. House prices have increased by 59% since 2007 but student loans have been cut. Large numbers of students here spent their entire student loans on housing alone and it’s getting more and more unaffordable every year.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum halls costs are £121 p/w to £146 p/w. 
Private housing costs roughly the same. 
There is a shortage of jobs for students who need to work to afford rent, food and necessities. A number of students work outside of Winchester to secure work. Other students choose to live in surrounding towns and cities for cheaper rent. 

https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/uk-least-affordable-cities-house-prices-london-oxford-a7606326.html

https://www.winchester.ac.uk/accommodation-and-winchester-life/accommodation/costs/ 

https://www.your-move.co.uk/estate-agent/winchester/find-property-for-rent

attributes.action: Ban over taking on the A35 one of Dorset’s most dangerous roads!
attributes.background: The a35 Dorset between Poole and Bere Regis is fast becoming one of Dorset’s deadliest roads. We have seen many deaths and road closures over the last few years and now it’s time to keep the road users safe. Make this road a no over taking policy road and reduce the speed limit.

attributes.action: Ensure vics of CSA under UK est care get full legal redress like NSW & Victoria
attributes.background: With IICSA currently investigating the full extent of CSA in the UK, we the undersigned believe that all councils and establishments under whose care such occurs should by law provide full legal redress.
attributes.additional_details: We require Parliament to pass an Act to make it possible as is the case in NSW and Victoria, Australia for victims of child sex abuse to be permitted full legal redress automatically.

attributes.action: Government to fund a scheme for carers flying with a person with disabilities
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to look into possible concessions for carers who have to fly with disabled people,I understand it’s not a governmental problem it’s in it’s a commercial problem but surely there is something you can do
attributes.additional_details: These concessions are desperately needed for example  I flew to Australia in 2005 and because I’m 6’5 I’m unable to fly economy so I’m forced to fly business or first class, on this occasion I paid for first class seats but I had to provide a equal seat for my carer and the total cost for the flight was £13,000 surely you can see this is totally disgusting.  Just because I’m disabled that doesn’t mean I shouldn’t be able to go on holiday when I want

attributes.action: Repeal compulsory Relationships and Sex Education(RSE) to all UK Faith schools
attributes.background: Government plans to implement non-faith based teachings to all faith schools in the UK which is contrary to existence of faith schools

attributes.action: Make funeral wishes legally binding documents.
attributes.background: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding. It's ultimately it is for your executors or administrators (where there are no executors) to decide upon how your body is disposed of and your funeral conducted. This is not acceptable. Surely a person who leaves an estate has the right to choose how their funeral is conducted and how their body is disposed of.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Keep British Summer Time (BST) all year round in UK
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST or Daylight Saving Time - DST) is 1 hour ahead of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). The UK has BST from late March to late October.  With BST there are lighter evenings, darker mornings, but lighter afternoons, greater happiness, fewer accidents and increased productivity

attributes.action: Use paper-based assessments for those DWP claimants who have been through abuse.
attributes.background: Abuse & Child Sexual Exploitation leaves a remaining scar on those who have been through the issue, meaning that talking about it can be extremely traumatic. It makes those who have been through CSE relive the events of that trauma, impacting not only their physical but mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The current interview process is damaging for CSE victims. As a CSE victim I was ignored by the DWP. I was promised a Mental Health Nurse assessment and didn't see one. The general nurse didn't understand my issues. A paper-based assessment would protect victims from reliving trauma. 
Health Impacts of Child Sexual Exploitation - http://www.barnardos.org.uk/health_impacts_of_child_sexual_exploitation.pdf 

The Impact of CSE https://paceuk.info/about-cse/the-impact-of-child-sexual-exploitation/ 
Long Term Effects of CSE - https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.3109/01612848909140847

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive 4 yearly instalments of their maintenance loan.
attributes.background: Most academic years of degrees start at mid to late September and end in May meaning three yearly instalments is ok for them. Nursing students don't end until August and start their next year in the same month! They are expected to survive on the same as those who aren't in the same situations.
attributes.additional_details: Three instalments does not give a student nurse enough support to fund their accommodation or basic health and wellbeing!

attributes.action: Make ‘Settled Application’ free for EU citizens
attributes.background:
There are about 2.9 million EU citizens living in the UK, the majority of whom came to the UK in good faith and are hard working taxpayers. 

We feel it a stab in the back to make them pay for acquiring 'settled' status. Why should they be the victims of brexit, when they had no say in the matter?

attributes.action: Call on Parliament to censure President Trump for his policy choices
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to use the opportunity of President Trump's visit to the UK to condemn in the strongest terms his policy choices. We ask that Parliament pass a motion which makes clear our opposition to his regressive policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The Muslim ban. Separating families at the border. Pulling out of the Paris agreement and the Iran deal. Starting trade wars. His approach to the media. Saying there were 'fine people on both sides' following the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville. His response to NFL protests against police violence. These are just a handful of the President's political choices that many people in the UK find troubling. 

We call on our representatives to make clear that we do not support these views.

attributes.action: Bring AS exams back and rid of A Level exams for the sake of youth mental health
attributes.background: AS exams have been dwindled away due to Michael Gove’s, former education secretary, reforms to A-Level exams. Previously, students would learn a years worth of content and then take the exam, now majority of exams are taken after the 2 year course. A Level exams are also getting harder
attributes.additional_details:
This pressure and strain leads to mental health issues such as anxiety, panic, emotional distress and depression to name a few. The calls mental health organizations receive have been increasing significantly over the years, leaving some dropping out of sixth form altogether in hand reducing teenagers motivation

To say these issues can be eradicated by ridding of the linear style would be inaccurate but it can surely reduce it and make the A-Level process much easier and more controllable.

attributes.action: Stop male day old chicks being killed.
attributes.background: Millions of male chicks are killed every year. Because the industry has no monetary use for them. Once hatched they are sexed at one day old. Then separated to be ground to a pulp. Not very humane.
attributes.additional_details: All Battery hens are all female. So males have no use.

attributes.action: Place a price ceiling on the cost of therapeutic oxygen for inflight use.
attributes.background: I suffer from a collection of  congenital heart defects which means that I require the use of therapeutic oxygen when I fly on an aircraft. The cost of this is upwards from £50 per flight. Some airlines ask you to provide your own oxygen through a private company which costs around £300 per week.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the travel industry is capitalising on peoples illnesses, and receiving a huge profit on the sale of therapeutic oxygen, which is essential a bottle of air, as medical grade oxygen is available to purchase for £6.64 on the BOC website. 
https://www.boconline.co.uk/shop/en/uk/healthcare/medical-gas/oxygen-cylinder-medical-grade-compressed-gas
 I am calling for a price limit to be placed on therapeutic inflight oxygen as it is unfair for the industry to make money off my illness.

attributes.action: Give the English a referendum to decide on a song to be our national anthem.
attributes.background: Currently, we use God Save the Queen at sporting events. However, it is not the popular choice according to some opinion polls. I believe that the English by-and-large want to use Jerusalem as their anthem.
attributes.additional_details:
With demand this high, we should at least have a right to a democratic say in what our anthem should be.
 
https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News
 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296
 
A Bill about this was given its first reading, yet hasn't received a second reading: https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/jan/13/mps-debate-replacing-god-save-the-queen-england-anthem

attributes.action: Increase the VAT threshold for small businesses.
attributes.background: As a small business that operates on a purely residential basis - in private homes where any added VAT is not claimed back by home owners - I feel that all small businesses would benefit from a raised VAT cap which would allow them to grow and would boost the economy further.
attributes.additional_details: Small companies make up 96% of the business in the UK and contribute to 33% of employment and 22% of turnover. I feel that if small companies - specifically ones that cater purely to the needs of private households where added VAT is only a hinderance for all involved - had an increased VAT threshold of anywhere between £110,000-£150,000 then they would be encouraged to grow and in doing so support the UK economy even more.

attributes.action: Make it requirement for takeaways & restaurants to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background: As a country we should enforce ALL places where food is handled to display their food hygiene rating. Food hygiene is crucial and diseases and infections can occur from "poor hygiene" - we as paying customers have the right to know how hygienic our food is respectively.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a known fact that poor food hygiene is associated with serious cases of food poisoning and this could mean having to seek medical evaluation, if you have ever suffered from this you would know it is an unpleasant experience, and it is commonly associated with with pathogens such as Salmonella.
As paying customers we deserve the right to know the standard of hygiene that out food was prepared in respectively. 
This should also motivate those poor establishments to up their standards.

attributes.action: UK Government to work with the devolved assemblies to create UK free bus travel
attributes.background: Those who are 60 years and over can get free bus travel in Wales Scotland Northern Ireland and London while the rest of UK citizens have to pay. This surely is unfair on those of us who rely on bus travel for work and leisure in England. Please sign this petition to bring in a national standard
attributes.additional_details: Many people aged 60 and over struggle to pay the cost of bus travel. It makes sense to bring in a UK standard for all .This would also help with road congestion and therefore help to reduce pollution from car emissions. It should also improve bus services due to the extra demand by this age group.  Many other countries  actively promote the use of public transport to free up congested roads especially with  Hydrogen and Electric powered public transport.Cleaner air makes  a better environment

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: Lower car tax and fuel benefit for diesel company cars after this years tax hike
attributes.background: The company car has become a cash cow for the government over the last few years. Many field representatives earn modest salaries, and have job cars where they have no choice of  model, engine type, etc. I would like to see the system made more fair after this years massive increase in tax.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets supply a point in store to discard excessive packaging
attributes.background: Facility to remove excessive amount of packaging within the store. Force a change to packaging habits by supermarkets and prevent contamination of products to be recycled

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: To debate the impact of not returning FULL control of our fisheries to the UK.
attributes.background: The decision to continue to allow EU fishing vessels access to UK  waters crosses political boundaries as the current EU policy is damaging our fish stocks and our fishing industry. It needs to be a Brexit negotiation red line as a plastic free ocean without fish is failure

attributes.action: Establish 14th March as a public holiday
attributes.background: On the passing of Stephen Hawking establish a day on which to honour him and all the nation's mathematicians and scientists (eg Newton, Halley, Babbage, Lovelace, Somerville, Berners-Lee etc etc); to fall within UK Science Week; coinciding with Pi Day. .
attributes.additional_details: A public holiday to be observed on the 14th March, a day given to discussion, deliberation, display and development of science and to encourage involvement and understanding by all

attributes.action: To implement a fishery licence to shoot a maximum of 3 otters a year.
attributes.background:
The current growth rate and lack of food for the otter has ment many well stocked fisheries to now be under attack. 
The otter while understandably protected, has outgrown its surroundings and is now ruining livelihoods of a multi billion pound industry.
attributes.additional_details:
There is so many videos of otter damage to fish, birds and wild life something has to be done to protect, 
1. Fish stocks in rivers
2. Bird life on nature reserves and rivers 
3. Fishery livelihoods. 
The continuing release of otters since 1999 has grown.
Earsham 2006 149 otters released 
And many more have been released under the radar.  
Many expensive carp have fallen victim to the otter and has cost many fisheries thousands of pounds in otter fencing where allowed and replacement of fish.

attributes.action: Compulsory to not repay any Tax Credits overpayments until it's been disputed
attributes.background: So many people receive letters from tax credits about overpayments that have to be paid back before it can be disputed. We need to make it compulsory that all evidence and appeals are done before any repayments have to be set up.
attributes.additional_details: I personally have been in this situation and from speaking to a number of people that have also experienced this, it would seem that once tax credits have received repayments or some form of monthly repayment method then they are no longer interested at looking at any evidence to dispute an overpayment. Therefore people are left with debts that are incorrect and have to pay them all back because they don't think they have any other option.

attributes.action: Fund the provision of support dogs for assault or abuse survivors with PTSD.
attributes.background: The government could fund and support charities to be able to specifically help the availability of these dogs for sexual assault or domestic violence survivors instead the charities allowing only war veterans to obtain a emotional support dog in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that 20 percent of soldiers come home for war with PTSD however they've also shown that out of all sexual assault, rape or domestic violence survivors that 30 percent have PTSD. Studies have also proved that 82 percent of people (in the USA) with an emotional support dog had a reduction in symptoms like anxiety attacks and nightmares than before and 40 percent reported that they reduced their use of medication. The impacts of these dogs is astronomical to someone's daily life.

attributes.action: Give the parents of twins or multiples maternity leave per child
attributes.background: Currently the parents of twins, triplets, quads etc. Only receive one years maternity leave for one parent. We feel parents should receive maternity leave per child.

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Reinstate DLA for those with mental health or learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Personal Independence Payments criteria is frightfully ill-suited for those claimants that have a form of learning difficulty or mental health condition. The PIP criteria is dreadfully preposterous for this division of society. We are asking the government to reinstate DLA for these groups.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the government to reconsider their options in regards to reinstating the Disability Living Allowance Criteria for this group of claimants. The following links back up the point of this petition.
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-fit-to-work-assessments-cost-more-than-they-save-report-reveals-a6801636.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-mental-health-discrimination-pip-cuts-mobility-mind-a7629866.html

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".
